SEARCH
Package org.jfree.chart.title

Class Title

java.lang.Object
org.jfree.chart.block.AbstractContentBlock
org.jfree.chart.title.Title
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Block, ContentBlock, org.jfree.ui.Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ACITextTitle, AttributedTextTitle, CompositeTitle, ImageTitle, LegendTitle, TextTitle
public abstract class Title extends AbstractContentBlock implements Block, Cloneable, Serializable
The base class for all chart titles. A chart can have multiple titles, appearing at the top, bottom, left or right of the chart.

Concrete implementations of this class will render text and images, and hence do the actual work of drawing titles.

Author:
David Berry
See Also:

    • Title

      protected Title(org.jfree.ui.RectangleEdge position, org.jfree.ui.HorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment, org.jfree.ui.VerticalAlignment verticalAlignment)
      Creates a new title, using default attributes where necessary.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the title (null not permitted).
      horizontalAlignment - the horizontal alignment of the title (null not permitted).
      verticalAlignment - the vertical alignment of the title (null not permitted).

    • Title

      protected Title(org.jfree.ui.RectangleEdge position, org.jfree.ui.HorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment, org.jfree.ui.VerticalAlignment verticalAlignment, org.jfree.ui.RectangleInsets padding)
      Creates a new title.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the title (null not permitted).
      horizontalAlignment - the horizontal alignment of the title (LEFT, CENTER or RIGHT, null not permitted).
      verticalAlignment - the vertical alignment of the title (TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM, null not permitted).
      padding - the amount of space to leave around the outside of the title (null not permitted).

      Specified by:

      Specified by:

      The layout result.

    • arrangeNN

      protected abstract ArrangeResult arrangeNN(Graphics2D g2, ArrangeParams params)
      Calculates the size of the title content (excludes margin, border and padding) if there is no constraint. This is either the natural size of the text, or the block size if this has been specified manually.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeNF

      protected abstract ArrangeResult arrangeNF(Graphics2D g2, double fixedHeight, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the block with no width constraint and a fixed height, returning the size of the content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      fixedHeight - the fixed height.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeRN

      protected ArrangeResult arrangeRN(Graphics2D g2, Range widthRange, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the block with a range constraint on the width and no height constraint, returning the size of the content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      widthRange - the width range.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeRR

      protected ArrangeResult arrangeRR(Graphics2D g2, Range widthRange, Range heightRange, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the block with a range constraint on the width and height, returning the size of the content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      widthRange - the width range.
      heightRange - the height range.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeRF

      protected ArrangeResult arrangeRF(Graphics2D g2, Range widthRange, double fixedHeight, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the content of the title with a range constraint for the title width and a fixed height, and returns the size of the title content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      widthRange - the width range.
      fixedHeight - the fixed height.
      params - the layout parameters (null permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeFN

      protected abstract ArrangeResult arrangeFN(Graphics2D g2, double fixedWidth, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the block with a fixed width and no height constraint, returning the size of the content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      fixedWidth - the fixed width.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeFR

      protected ArrangeResult arrangeFR(Graphics2D g2, double fixedWidth, Range heightRange, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the block with a fixed width and range constraint for the height, returning the size of the content.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      fixedWidth - the fixed width.
      heightRange - the height range.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • arrangeFF

      protected abstract ArrangeResult arrangeFF(Graphics2D g2, double fixedWidth, double fixedHeight, ArrangeParams params)
      Arranges the title with a fixed width and height.
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      fixedWidth - the fixed (content) width.
      fixedHeight - the fixed (content) height.
      params - the layout parameters (null not permitted).
      Returns:
      The layout result.

    • draw

      public abstract void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area)
      Draws the title on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a printer).
      Specified by:
      draw in interface org.jfree.ui.Drawable
      Parameters:
      g2 - the graphics device.
      area - the area allocated for the title (subclasses should not draw outside this area).

    • clone

      public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException
      Returns a clone of the title.

      One situation when this is useful is when editing the title properties - you can edit a clone, and then it is easier to cancel the changes if necessary.

      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      A clone of the title.
      Throws:
      CloneNotSupportedException - not thrown by this class, but it may be thrown by subclasses.
